Package chase.minecraft.architectury.warpmod.utils

Class MathUtils

java.lang.Object
chase.minecraft.architectury.warpmod.utils.MathUtils
public class MathUtils extends Object
The MathUtils class contains methods for rounding numbers to a specified number of decimal places and generating random 2D positions within a given range around a center point.

  • Method Details

    • round

      public static double round(double from, int decimals)
      The function rounds a given double value to a specified number of decimal places.
      Parameters:
      from - The number that needs to be rounded to a certain number of decimal places.
      decimals - The number of decimal places to round the input number to.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a double value that is rounded to the specified number of decimal places.

    • round

      public static float round(float from, int decimals)
      The function rounds a given float number to a specified number of decimal places.
      Parameters:
      from - The number that needs to be rounded to a certain number of decimal places.
      decimals - The number of decimal places to round the float value to.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a float value that is rounded to the specified number of decimal places.

    • getRandom2DPosition

      public static net.minecraft.world.phys.Vec2 getRandom2DPosition(net.minecraft.world.phys.Vec3 center, int max)
      The function returns a random 2D position within a specified range around a given center point.
      Parameters:
      center - A Vec3 object representing the center point of the 2D space from which a random position will be generated.
      max - The maximum distance from the center point in the x and y directions that the random 2D position can be generated.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a 2D vector position (Vec2) that is randomly generated within a certain range (specified by the "max" parameter) around a given 3D center point (specified by the "center" parameter). The method is using another method called "getRandom2DPosition" with additional parameters to generate the random position.

    • getRandom2DPosition

      public static net.minecraft.world.phys.Vec2 getRandom2DPosition(net.minecraft.world.phys.Vec3 center, int min, int max)
      This function returns a random 2D position within a given range around a center point in 3D space.
      Parameters:
      center - A Vec3 object representing the center point of the 2D space from which a random position will be generated.
      min - The minimum distance from the center in the x and y directions for the random 2D position.
      max - The maximum distance from the center in the x and y directions to generate a random 2D position.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a 2D vector (Vec2) representing a random position within a specified range (min to max) around a given center point (Vec3). The fourth parameter (true) indicates whether the position should be restricted to within a circle centered at the given center point.

    • getRandom2DPosition

      public static net.minecraft.world.phys.Vec2 getRandom2DPosition(net.minecraft.world.phys.Vec3 center, int min, int max, boolean includeNegative)
      This function generates a random 2D position around a given center point within a specified range, with the option to include negative values.
      Parameters:
      center - A Vec3 object representing the center point around which the random 2D position will be generated.
      min - The minimum value for the x and y coordinates of the generated random position.
      max - The maximum value for the randomly generated x and y coordinates.
      includeNegative - A boolean value that determines whether the generated x and y values can be negative or not. If set to true, the generated values can be negative. If set to false, the generated values will always be positive.
      Returns:
      A Vec2 object representing a randomly generated 2D position around a given center point, with the x and y coordinates determined by a random integer between a given minimum and maximum value, and the option to include negative values.
